intro: Phlojodicarpus villosus, commonly known as the hairy sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and blue to purple flowers that bloom in winter. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in coastal and sandy environments. The species is adapted to salt spray and well-drained soils, making it a hardy coastal plant. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
